summary:
Shinto is a Japanese religion focused on nature and supernatural beings called kami. It has no single founder or central authority. Kami are found in nature, like mountains and trees, and are worshipped in shrines. People visit shrines to seek blessings and harmony with kami. Shinto emphasizes cleanliness and has rituals like washing before worship.

It has ancient roots, but its distinct form emerged during the Meiji era when it became Japan's national religion. Today, Shinto is mainly practiced in Japan, with many people combining it with Buddhism.
title: Shinto
